comments.body: Are you describing explanations that appear in method docstrings here, or non-generated reference guide content?

Mainly non-generated reference guide content. The docstrings are a separate thing, and should be kept (in my opinion). The idea is that the reference guide should be cleaner and long explanations can be linked to from a separate "Explanations" section.
I think this is clear. @eric-wieser if you need some clarification in the text, perhaps suggest an addition/rephrase?

comments.body: I doubt that anything we can do will limit the number of people writing tutorials on the web, make them update or take down outdated ones, etc.  SEO is another story, but I don't think this helps in that regard.  There is also a sentence here that reads funny: users end up in an outdated tutorial and create content? Don't the tutorial authors create content, and users create code?  Which do you mean?
Thanks for that, I rewrote that sentence.

Status and ideas of each type of doc content

comments.body: Do API docs or under-the-hood docs fit in here somewhere?

API docs are the same as "Reference Guide". @melissawm maybe change to `Reference Guide (API reference)` for clarity?

under-the-hood docs is a good suggestion, there are definitely topics like that that we already have docs for or that would be useful. If it helps users understand things, then I'd say it falls under Explanations. If it's developer-focused (e.g. how to add a new ufunc), then we may need a new category because "Contributor Guide" is meant to be more about the process of contributing (setting up a dev environment, style guide, etc.). I don't have a great name for that category to suggest; maybe add "Under-the-hood docs" as a placeholder for now, unless someone has a better idea?
I added under-the-hood docs for now.
